meanings.definition: A contagious skin infection caused by a fungus.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the child with ringworm and prescribed an antifungal cream.
meanings.sent2: My cat caught ringworm from another stray cat in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: Why did the mushroom go to the party? Because it wanted to spread some ringworm!
meanings.sent4: The ringworm of rumors spread through the small town like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The red, itchy ringworm on her arm made her feel self-conscious at the beach.

meanings.definition: A small worm-shaped mark or growth.
meanings.sent1: The old tree stump had a ringworm that resembled a tiny snake.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler noticed a ringworm in the wood grain of the antique table.
meanings.sent3: The ringworm on the apple made it look like it had a tiny worm crawling on it.
meanings.sent4: The ringworm of cracks on the wall seemed to form a mysterious pattern.
meanings.sent5: The ringworm on the leaf looked like a miniature earthworm trying to escape.
